excerptsHtml: SMCSD requires a compliance certificate for all private laterals... when the property's title is being transferred (resale), ...
dataSources.name: Sausalito-Marin Sanitary District

paragraphsHtml: The City requires that this inspection to be performed by a certified plumber, and that the “Go Forward Lateral” inspection software be used for documenting, reporting and submitting the inspection.
It takes about 3-4 weeks to obtain a compliance certificate (1 week to schedule and conduct an inspection, plus 2-3 weeks for the city to review the inspection video) at a total cost of $400-450.
The City of Sausalito maintains a list of certified plumbers here: https://www.sausalito.gov/home/showpublisheddocument?id=26252.
The city's Sewer Division also offers this inspection as a service, as outlined here.

noteworthy.paragraphHtml: The City does not conduct a physical building inspection.

paragraphsHtml: This inspection is required prior to the close of escrow.
It takes about 3 weeks to obtain this report at a cost of $490. Follow the instructions on the City's website to obtain this report.

excerptsHtml: The seller of any real property containing a water heater shall certify to the prospective purchaser that this section [19211] has been complied with.
dataSources.name: California Health And Safety Code

paragraphsHtml: All residential water heaters must be braced, anchored, or strapped to resist falling or horizontal displacement due to earthquake motion. This usually means securing water heaters with two seismic straps - one located within the top 1/3 of the unit, and one at the bottom 1/3. The bottom strap must be located at least 4" away from the water heater controls.
The seller must certify that the water heater code has been followed.
